notes.text: Red Hat Ansible Tower 3.7.4-1 - RHEL7 Container
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
* Fixed two jQuery vulnerabilities (CVE-2020-11022, CVE-2020-11023)
* Improved Ansible Tower's web service configuration to allow for processing more simultaneous HTTP(s) requests by default
* Updated several dependencies of Ansible Tower's User Interface to address (CVE-2020-7720, CVE-2020-7743, CVE-2020-7676)
* Updated to the latest version of python-psutil to address CVE-2019-18874
* Added several optimizations to improve performance for a variety of high-load simultaneous job launch use cases
* Fixed workflows to no longer prevent certain users from being able to edit approval nodes
* Fixed confusing behavior for social auth logins across distinct browser tabs
* Fixed launching of Job Templates that use prompt-at-launch Ansible Vault credentials
notes.title: Details

full_product_name.name: ansible-tower-37/ansible-tower-rhel7@sha256:46d02d82c8b89dc22259fd4d8ea2febd9c64427239806da48f97b0c96be157e5_amd64 as a component of Red Hat Ansible Tower 3.7 for RHEL 7

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

notes.text: A double free issue has been discovered in python-psutil because of the mishandling of refcounts while converting system data into Python objects in functions like psutil_disk_partitions(), psutil_users(), psutil_net_if_addrs(), and others. In particular cases, a local attacker may be able to get code execution by manipulating system resources that python-psutil then tries to convert.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: python-psutil: Double free because of refcount mishandling
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A XSS flaw was found in nodejs-angular. The regex-based input HTML replacement may turn sanitized code into unsanitized one. Wrapping "\<option\>" elements in "\<select\>" ones changes parsing behavior, leading to possibly unsanitizing code.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: nodejs-angular: XSS due to regex-based HTML replacement
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

vulnerabilities.title: nodejs-angular: XSS due to regex-based HTML replacement

notes.text: A flaw was found in nodejs-node-forge. A Prototype Pollution via the util.setPath function is possible.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: nodejs-node-forge: prototype pollution via the util.setPath function
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
In Red Hat Openshift Container Storage 4 the noobaa-core container includes the affected version of node-forge as a dependency of google-p12-pem, however the vulnerable function `util.setPath` is not being used and hence this issue has been rated as having a security impact of Low.

In OpenShift Container Platform (OCP) the prometheus container is behind OpenShift OAuth restricting access to the vulnerable node-forge library to authenticated users only, therefore the impact is Low.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: A Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in JQuery. This flaw allows an attacker with the ability to supply input to the âHTMLâ function to inject Javascript into the page where that input is rendered, and have it delivered by the browser.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A flaw was found in jQuery. HTML containing \<option\> elements from untrusted sources are passed, even after sanitizing, to one of jQuery's DOM manipulation methods, which may execute untrusted code. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jquery: Untrusted code execution via <option> tag in HTML passed to DOM manipulation methods
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Enterprise Linux versions 6, 7, and 8 ship a vulnerable version of JQuery in the `pcs` component. As PCS does not accept untrusted input, the vulnerable code cannot be controlled by an attacker.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability
